title: Volcanology Vocabulary
description: Explore the fiery vocabulary of volcanology, from eruption types and lava flows to volcanic formations and tectonic forces.

questions.question: What is 'magma'?
options: Molten rock beneath the Earth's surface

questions.question: What is the difference between 'magma' and 'lava'?
options: Magma is molten rock below the surface; lava is molten rock that has reached the surface
Magma is found only in oceans

questions.question: What is a 'caldera'?
options: A large crater formed by the collapse of a volcano after an eruption

questions.question: What does 'pyroclastic flow' refer to?
options: A fast-moving current of hot gas, ash, and volcanic rock that flows down a volcano's slopes

questions.question: What is 'tephra'?
options: A type of volcanic rock found only underwater
Fragments of rock and other material ejected into the air by a volcanic eruption
Cooled lava on the ocean floor

questions.question: What is a 'fumarole'?
options: An opening in the Earth's surface that emits steam and volcanic gases

questions.question: What is 'pumice'?
options: A type of gem found near volcanoes
A light, porous volcanic rock formed from frothy lava that can float on water

questions.question: What is a 'shield volcano'?
options: A volcano surrounded by a moat
A broad, gently sloping volcano built by fluid lava flows, like those in Hawaii

questions.question: What does 'dormant' mean when describing a volcano?
options: Currently inactive but capable of erupting again in the future

questions.question: What is a 'lahar'?
options: A destructive mudflow of volcanic debris and water

questions.question: What is 'obsidian'?
options: A dark, glassy volcanic rock formed when lava cools very rapidly
A mineral found only in calderas

questions.question: What is the 'Ring of Fire'?
options: A horseshoe-shaped zone around the Pacific Ocean known for frequent earthquakes and volcanic eruptions

questions.question: What is a 'stratovolcano'?
options: A tall, steep volcano built up by alternating layers of lava, ash, and rock, like Mount Fuji
A volcano made entirely of ash

questions.question: What is 'volcanic ash'?
options: Fine particles of pulverized rock and glass ejected during a volcanic eruption

questions.question: What is a 'geyser'?
options: A hot spring that periodically erupts, sending a column of water and steam into the air
A crack in the Earth's crust
